title: MAGO-SP: Detection and Correction of Water-Fat Swaps in Magnitude-Only VIBE MRI
author: Robert Graf (TUM University Hospital), Hendrik Möller (TUM University Hospital), Sophie Starck (TUM University Hospital), Matan Atad (TUM University Hospital), Philipp Braun (TUM University Hospital), Jonathan Stelter (TUM University Hospital), Annette Peters (Helmholtz Zentrum München), Jan Kirschke (TUM University Hospital)
background: Detecting and correcting incorrect water and fat signal assignments in MRI images to ensure accurate medical imaging and analysis.
contribution: This paper introduces an automated pipeline for detecting and correcting water-fat swaps in MRI, achieving less than 1% error rates in swaps detection.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggled with ambiguity in signal reconstruction, leading to errors in image quality and quantitative measurements.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs a segmentation model, a denoising diffusion network, and physics-based optimization to improve swap detection and correction.

key_innovation: Combines deep learning for segmentation with physical constraints in MRI imaging to achieve robust signal separation.
real_world_impact: Improves reliability in imaging diagnostics, potentially affecting treatment decisions in conditions like obesity and diabetes by ensuring accurate fat quantification.
limitations: Variations between MRI vendors and reconstruction methods remain unexplored.

new_terms.proton density fat fraction (PDFF): **Proton density fat fraction (PDFF)** is a quantitative measure of the fat content within tissues, expressed as a percentage of total tissue volume.
new_terms.Denoising diffusion: **Denoising diffusion** refers to methods that progressively refine images by reversing a noise process, improving visibility of key structures.

open_sourcing: Code and trained models are available under https://github.com/robert-graf/MAGO-SP
